author: Vanessa Brown
title: Melbourne Cup fashion: Spring Carnival fashion tips | Rachael Finch, Emma Freedman | DailyTelegraph
text:
CAN YOU hear those hoofs beating? The smell of champagne and canapés in the air? Gear up ladies, because the fashion stakes are high. The Spring Carnival is well and truly here — and you have just one week to get races ready for the biggest races week of the year.
DERBY DAY:
With just a week until D-Day, it’s time to get out your best shades of black and white — because aside from a little lipstick and jockey silks, there shouldn’t be any other colour on the track.
Derby Day is the perfect event to test fashion boundaries, such as a tuxedo or jumpsuit. Picture: Supplied.
Rachael Finch displays a perfect look for Derby Day. Picture: Tim Carrafa
Have fun with colour at the Cup Picture: SDP Media
Jessica Gomes keeps it simple with a wide brimmed hat at the Caulfield Cup. Picture: AAP/Julian Smith.
Fresh floral headbands are a bright look if you’re stuck for time on Cup Day. Picture: Supplied.
Rachael Finch: Cup is all about colour Picture: Tim Carrafa
Rachael Finch and Ashley Hart keep their look natural at Oaks Day 2014 in Melbourne. Picture: Scott Barbour/Getty Images)
Men should try an include a flash of floral on Oaks Day. Picture: Andrew Tauber
Have fun with patterns, and let the kids dress up on Stakes Day. Picture: Hamish Blair
Cute kidswear that’s race day appropriate. Picture: Hamish Blair
